pull.title: Test rpc_help.py failed: Check whether ZMQ is enabled or not.
pull.body: /test/functional/rpc_help.py checks for the zmq-category even while zmq may be disabled (in /test/config.ini) , I have added a check function to test_framework.py that can be used whether to determine to include zmq in a test or not.

events.body:
Thanks @Kvaciral, this was on my TODO after @MarcoFalke https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14020#pullrequestreview-150958484.

utACK 14e7176, mind some nits.

events.message: Test rpc_help.py failed: Check whether ZMQ is enabled or not.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -4,7 +4,7 @@
 # file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
 """Test RPC help output."""
 
-from test_framework.test_framework import BitcoinTestFramework
+from test_framework.test_framework import (BitcoinTestFramework, is_zmq_enabled)

@@ -25,7 +25,13 @@ def run_test(self):
 
         # command titles
         titles = [line[3:-3] for line in node.help().splitlines() if line.startswith('==')]
-        assert_equal(titles, ['Blockchain', 'Control', 'Generating', 'Mining', 'Network', 'Rawtransactions', 'Util', 'Wallet', 'Zmq'])
+
+        components = ['Blockchain', 'Control', 'Generating', 'Mining', 'Network', 'Rawtransactions', 'Util', 'Wallet']
+
+        if is_zmq_enabled(self):
comments.body:
nit, my preference is
```py
if is_zmq_enabled(self):
    assert_equal(titles, ['Blockchain', 'Control', 'Generating', 'Mining', 'Network', 'Rawtransactions', 'Util', 'Wallet', 'Zmq'])
else:
    assert_equal(titles, ['Blockchain', 'Control', 'Generating', 'Mining', 'Network', 'Rawtransactions', 'Util', 'Wallet'])
```

comments.body: I disagree, my code is more flexible..

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -25,7 +25,13 @@ def run_test(self):
 
         # command titles
         titles = [line[3:-3] for line in node.help().splitlines() if line.startswith('==')]
-        assert_equal(titles, ['Blockchain', 'Control', 'Generating', 'Mining', 'Network', 'Rawtransactions', 'Util', 'Wallet', 'Zmq'])
+
+        components = ['Blockchain', 'Control', 'Generating', 'Mining', 'Network', 'Rawtransactions', 'Util', 'Wallet']
+
+        if is_zmq_enabled(self):
comments.body: there might be more optional categories in the future, which would result in a combination blow-up (say, if we ever make the functional tests run without wallet). I prefer adding them one by one as it is now.
